1. This road sign means:
2. This white sign means you:
column4: must wait for the solid green light before you turn left.
column6: may turn left on a green light when it is safe to do so.
column8: may turn left only on a green arrow.

column2: 3. Arrows on the roadway:
column6: show which lanes you must use.
column8: indicate that you can not pass or change lanes.

column2: 4. Destination signs are ______ with ____ letters and symbols.

8. Who has a greater risk of being involved in a traffic crash?

10. You hear a siren close by but can not see where the emergency vehicle is. What do you do?
column4: Keep driving until you are sure the emergency vehicle is headed toward you.
column6: Stop immediately and activate your emergency flashers.
column8: Pull over to the right side of the road and stop until you are sure the emergency vehicle is not headed toward you.
column10: Stop only if you are sure that the vehicle is headed toward you in the opposite lane.

column2: 11. This road sign means:
column10: Traffic flows only in the direction of the arrow

column2: 12. It is important for drivers to know that trucks:
column4: take longer than cars to stop.
column6: require less time to pass on an incline than cars.
column8: require more space for turning movements.
column10: are easier for the driver to operate.

column2: 13. On average, how long does it take your body to remove the alcohol contained in 5 ounces of wine?
14. You must come to a full stop at a yield sign:
column10: Before you decrease speed and reach the intersection.

column2: 15. The yield sign is ___ and white, with ___ letters.
16. This road sign means:
column10: Divided highway ahead - stay to the right

column2: 17. If another car has stopped in an adjacent lane in the same direction of travel, you should:
column4: speed up and pass the vehicle on the right.
column6: be careful in case the other vehicle has stopped for a pedestrian.
column8: pass the car on the left.
column10: tap your horn to let the other driver know you are passing.

column2: 18. This sign warns drivers of:
19. When they see this sign, drivers:
column4: should be prepared to make sharp turns at a high speed.
column6: need to be prepared to turn right and then left quickly.
column8: should not speed up or brake quickly.

column2: 20. This sign tells drivers that:
column4: they must stop at the next intersection.
column6: left and right turns are not allowed.

column2: 21. If you are pulled over by law enforcement, you should:
column4: turn off on your interior light if stopped at night.
column6: get out of your vehicle and walk toward the patrol car.
column8: unbuckle your seat belt and lower your window.
column10: stay in the driver’s seat with both hands clearly in sight on the steering wheel.

column2: 22. When driving at night with no other vehicles ahead, a driver should use:
23. This road sign means:
column6: Cars in right lane must slow down
column10: Pass only in the right lane

column2: 24. What is the first thing you should do if your wheels move off the pavement?
column6: Ease your foot off the gas pedal and brake gently.
column8: Pull over to the right and sound your horn to warn the other drivers.
column10: Try pumping the gas pedal to increase pressure.

column2: 25. This road sign means:
column10: Traffic is entering from another road, drive with caution

column2: 26. This road sign means:
column4: Winding road ahead; slow down to the indicated speed
column6: Merge, then slow down to the safe speed indicated
column8: The road ahead curves right; slow down to indicated speed
column10: Divided highway begins. Slow down to the safe speed indicated

column2: 27. Your first response to reduced visibility should be:
column6: to turn on your windshield wipers.
column8: to look for road edge markings to guide you.

column2: 28. Green and white signs:
column4: warn drivers of unexpected road conditions.
column8: are mainly used at intersections and driveways.
column10: give information about directions and distances.

column2: 29. When following a motorcycle, drivers do not need to allow as much distance as when following a car.
30. Traffic lights are normally ____________ from the top to bottom or left to right.
31. When driving in fog, drivers should use:
32. If another vehicle passes you on the left, you must:
column4: increase your speed slightly and keep to the right.
column6: increase your speed and move to the left.
column8: decrease your speed slightly and keep to the right.
column10: decrease your speed, then pull over to the right and stop.

column2: 33. This road sign means:
column10: Keep right, traffic is entering from another road.

column2: 34. Drivers may continue carefully through a yellow light if:
column4: an emergency vehicle is crossing your lane.
column8: they already are within the intersection.

column2: 35. This sign means:
column4: No parking between 8:30 AM and 5:30 PM.
column6: You can only park between 8:30 AM and 5:30 PM.
column8: Parking is not allowed at 8:30 AM and at 5:30 PM

column2: 36. This road sign means:
column8: You must come to a complete stop
column10: Slow down, stop if necessary and yield the right-of-way

column2: 37. This sign means:
38. After parking, are you allowed to open a door on the road side of your vehicle?
column6: Yes, but only if oncoming vehicles or bicycles are at least 10 feet away.
column10: Yes, but only if it does not interfere with bicyclists and other traffic.

column2: 39. After you stop for a school bus, you must:
column6: pass the bus before the red lights stop flashing.
column8: wait until the red lights stop flashing.

column2: 40. When you approach a railroad crossing without flashing warning signals or crossing gates, you should:
column6: speed up to beat the train.
column8: yield to all trains at the crossing.
column10: cross the tracks as slowly as possible.
